page.title: 05Attitudes,Scoutmoor
page.content: People living in Scoutmoor found the countryside scenic and tranquil,and it was this that attracted them to the area. Many people,especially the aged ,found the bus service inadequate ,as there is only one bus every two hours. However,people are prepared to travel long distances for shopping,leisure and entertainment.They do buy everyday items in one of the local villages. Some children have to travel 17 miles to Risworth near Halifax to go to school,which caused a problem. Elderly people found facilities in the village adequate e.g clubs and fund raising events,but there was little for young people to do. Reopening of the quarry on Scoutmoor caused disturbance,mainly due to the noise from lorries.The noise from the animal santuary brought no complaints.
